trivia_items.text: His codename is a term that means "a period of keeping awake during the time usually spent asleep." The word is often used as a religious term, especially in Christianity.
His familia's surname, the Bellones, is the name of a wine grape variety that is cultivated in the current area of Rome to produce white wine.

Vigil's outfit resembles pinstripe suits that was once commonly found on mafiosi. In modern era, the said suit is available to many such as the Italian-American actor Al Pacino who sees it as a symbolism of bravado and orderliness.
Vigil is the first 6★ Operator with the following distinctions:
sub_items: He is the first male 6★ Vanguard.
He is the first welfare 6★ who debuts in a non-Anniversary event (CN)/Gift of the Deep Ones event (Global).
His debut is also the first case where the first 6★ Operator of a Vanguard branch is not affiliated with Victoria.

He is the first ever Operator (and first Welfare Operator) who uses Folders as the method of Potential increase, done by clearing missions from the event folder. His Potential cannot be raised through Operator and Class Tokens.

trivia_items.text: Vigil's ahoge is currently the longest one out of all operators.
With the release of Il Siracusano in Global, Vigil became the first male operator to receive 5 different voiceovers in 5 different languages.

At release, Vigil's summons had no range, in contrast to those of the summons of his fellow archetype members Blacknight and Muelsyse. This was changed later as it can now hit one tile away from the tile it's standing on.
